item.title: Battlefield 6 ‘Global Game Quota Exceeded’ Error, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 has roared onto the scene with an extremely successful launch, but plenty of players around the world are experiencing the ‘Global Game Quota Exceeded’ error.

Immediately smashing past Call of Duty’s all-time concurrent player count on Steam, Battlefield 6 is one of the most successful titles to have launched in 2025, and, with plenty of content planned in future updates, there’s plenty of excitement for what is to come.

Errors and bugs can halt your progress, however, and we’ve got all the details on the ‘Global Game Quota Exceeded’ error if it is thwarting your play sessions.

What is The Battlefield 6 Global Game Quota Exceeded Error?

The Battlefield 6 ‘Global Game Quota Exceeded’ error indicates that the servers on the Portal feature are currently full.

EA’s Portal feature, first introduced in Battlefield 2042, hosts community-created experiences, but it appears the servers are significantly more limited than they are for EA’s own game modes like Conquest and Escalation.

This will be due to a smaller capacity, likely because EA anticipates there are fewer players wanting to play these modes. However, the Global Game Quota Exceeded error is a clear indication that there is a larger demand than the servers can account for.

Is There a Fix For The Battlefield 6 Global Game Quota Exceeded Error?

No, there is currently no known fix to the Global Game Quota Exceeded error, and it’s unlikely to be anything that you can do on your end.

This is because it is a server-side issue based on the fact that more players are trying to play modes through Battlefield Portal than the system can account for. As such, any solution will have to come directly from EA to increase the server capacity for Portal.

At the time of writing, EA has yet to comment on the issue, but it’s still very early days in Battlefield’s lifespan, so there’s plenty of time for server changes to be made.

It’s likely the server capacity will be increased at some point, however, considering more people are likely to explore Portal game modes the longer time progresses since release, with a desire to experience more varied content.

What is the best mode you have uncovered so far on Battlefield Portal? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Battlefield 6, take a look at how to spot enemies in the game, and check out how to fix the multiplayer not installed bug.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov Player Count—How Many People Play Tarkov?
item.content:encoded:
Escape from Tarkov is the spearhead extraction shooter that has dominated the genre for a decade. It’s known as one of the most punishing games ever made, striking fear into the hearts of casual gamers worldwide since entering the scene in 2016.

Despite the game’s popularity, it’s pretty tough to get an exact number for how many people play Escape from Tarkov. In this guide, I’ve broken down the resources I have available to determine the most accurate Escape from Tarkov player count possible.

Read on to get the numbers we have.

Is Escape from Tarkov Popular?

There’s almost no information regarding the Escape from Tarkov player count that’s accessible to the public. Battlestate Games, the developer behind the extraction shooter, keeps a tight lid on the data.

However, in August 2025, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games offered a rare glimpse into the player numbers of Escape from Tarkov.

On a Saturday evening at around 9 PM (BST), 45,000 people were playing PvP in Escape from Tarkov.

As Escape from Tarkov is only available on PC through Battlestate Games’ launcher (until the Steam launch), there’s only one number to look at, but that number does not include PvE players. It was previously mentioned that the player count between PvE and PvP can be as balanced as 50-50, so it’s safe to assume another 45,000 were playing PvE at that time.

That means that Escape from Tarkov had 90,000 concurrent players at a peak time on the weekend.

In numerical terms, that means that Escape from Tarkov is very popular, and it’s also safe to assume that the number swells when a special event or a ‘wipe’ hits.

How to View Escape from Tarkov Player Count

At the time of publishing, there were no reliable methods to use to determine how many people were playing Escape from Tarkov.

However, the Steam release of Escape from Tarkov is set to arrive in 2025, which would open up the data to everyone based on Valve’s API system. That means you’ll be able to see how many people play Escape from Tarkov on Steam alone.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you’ve got a better way to determine Tarkov’s player count.

item.title: Fallout Season 2 Release Date—When is The New Season of Fallout Coming Out?
item.content:encoded:
Fallout’s first season was a rampant success, pulling in millions of viewers, reigniting a fierce love for the post-apocalyptic games, and allowing Bethesda Game Studios to flex some development power with Fallout 4’s next-gen upgrade.

Now, fans are waiting on the edges of their seats for Fallout Season 2, which is set to drop later this year. It’s an expansion on the story that played out in April 2024, with returning and new characters set to grace the screens in the post-nuclear wasteland of Fallout. When is Fallout Season 2 coming out, though?

Read on to find out.

Fallout Season 2 First Episode Date

Fallout Season 2 will be released on December 17, 2025. The first episode will give us a look at New Vegas, recreated in full, authentic fashion for the award-winning television series.

The first season dropped in April 2024 and gave fans of the franchise a whirlwind tour of a new setting, original story, and fresh characters. It was a phenomenal success, and for a while, player counts across every Fallout game skyrocketed.

That hype has continued, and in December, Fallout 76 will get a new update linked with the Fallout television show, launching alongside the second season.

Will Fallout Season 2 Be Released All At Once?

The second season of Fallout breaks away from the operating model of the first season and offers a once-weekly release pattern. The first episode drops on December 17, and the final episode will arrive on February 4. In total, there are eight episodes in the new season, which is the same format as the first season.

Confirmed Cast for Fallout Season 2

Fallout Season 2 features the following cast:

  • Lucy MacLean (Ella Purnell)
  • Maximus (Aaron Moten)
  • The Ghoul (Walton Goggins)
  • Dane (Xelia Mendes-Jones)
  • Hank MacLean (Kyle MacLachlan)
  • Norm MacLean (Moisés Arias)
  • Robert House (Justin Theroux)
  • Betty Pearson (Leslie Uggams)
  • Thaddeus (Johnny Pemberton)
  • Barb Howard (Frances Turner)

Additional characters are yet to be confirmed, such as the role for the rumored arrival of Macaulay Culkin.

Let me know if you’re excited about Fallout Season 2 on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Complete Pokémon Legends: Z-A Pokédex: All Pokémon, Listed
item.content:encoded:
It’s launch week for Pokémon Legends: Z-A, which means plenty of leaks are starting to emerge, and the full list of Pokémon available to catch in the Pokédex have been revealed.

Releasing October 16, Legends: Z-A is the second entry in the Pokémon Legends series, following on from the success of Legends: Arceus, and will kick off a big year for the franchise, with the 30th anniversary next year seeing the release of a new spin-off game, Pokopia, and the expected launch of Gen 10.

If you want to know exactly which Pokémon are available to hunt down in Legends: Z-A, we’ve got the full list for you.

The Pokémon Legends: Z-A Pokédex, based on the information currently available, has 243 Pokémon to collect—not including variants.

In comparison, Pokémon Legends: Arceus had 242 Pokémon, including the complete Sinnoh Pokédex, whereas Z-A does not have the full Kalos Pokédex. However, more Pokémon will be added in the Mega Evolution DLC, which has been confirmed to be released post-launch.

Unlike recent titles, there are no regional variants in Legends: Z-A, with the focus instead being on the introduction of new Mega Pokémon. There are 26 new Mega Pokémon in Legends: Z-A.

We’ve compiled a full list of the Pokémon available to capture in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, which we’ll update accordingly if any have been missed.

The table below shows all of the available Pokémon, including their variant forms. We’ve excluded gender forms from this list, along with the many variants of Flabebe and its evolution line, Vivillon, and Furfrou.

Which Pokémon are you disappointed aren’t featured in the Legends: Z-A Pokédex? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Pokémon, check out the preload guide and file size for Legends: Z-A, and check out the differences between the Switch 1 and Switch 2 versions.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-legends-z-a-pokedex/

item.title: Microsoft Addresses Target and Walmart Xbox Sale Rumors
item.content:encoded:
It was recently claimed online that Target and Walmart are preparing to halt the sale of Xbox products. This tidbit surfaced mere days after it was reported that Costco had stopped selling the Xbox Series S and Xbox Series X consoles.

However, after a few cursory calls around Target and Walmart stores revealed that wasn’t the case, Microsoft came out and offered clarity on the topic, and no, Target and Walmart are not halting the sale of Xbox consoles and games.

Xbox Consoles Are Still For Sale

It has been a rocky few weeks for Microsoft and Xbox, with claims circulating like wildfire that the tech titans are preparing to pull out of hardware entirely and focus on making and publishing games.

The latest round of rumors claimed that Target and Walmart, two of the United States’ biggest retailers, were preparing to shut down the sale of Xbox products in stores nationwide.

It took a few minutes on the phone with stores and representatives to determine that wasn’t the case in some areas, but then Microsoft came out with a concrete statement, handed to Windows Central:

Target and Walmart, among other retailers, remain committed partners for Xbox consoles, accessories, and games.

Price increases, layoffs, project cancellations, and departures have made this a tumultuous year for Xbox, and the propagation of rumors across social media isn’t helping the situation.

There’s no indication that any retailer other than Costco is reducing or stopping the sale of Xbox hardware. If you waltz into your local Target or Walmart, you’ll still see the consoles on the shelves, ready and waiting to be purchased.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you bought into these Xbox rumors.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the Pokémon Legends Z-A Pokédex has been leaked in full

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Pokédex Leaked in Full
item.content:encoded:
On social media, images have surfaced portraying the full Pokémon Legends ZA Pokédex, including Shiny variants and evolutions. The game is set to drop in just three days, but this leak has already uncovered all 243 Pokémon landing in Pokémon Legends Z-A when it’s released.

This is in addition to the full game’s ROM being launched into the wild and picked apart by dataminers worldwide. In recent Nintendo news, the company was reportedly breached by a hacker group, so it’s a tough time all around for the Japanese gaming titan.

In a series of posts on social media, images surfaced showcasing the full Pokédex for Pokémon Legends Z-A, set to be released on October 16. The first image revealed the 243 Pokémon coming to Z-A, while a follow-up revealed all the Shinies coming to the game at launch:

The same channel on X (formerly Twitter) went on to publish several screenshots from the game, exploring the Museum to uncover a Legends Arceus section, offering information about battle teams, and confirming details about Z-A Ranked Battles rewards.

As the hours rolled by, the channel posted shots of various Pokémon confirmed to be in Legends Z-A in Mega format:

  • Mega Froslass
  • Mega Scolipede
  • Mega Chandelure
  • Mega Zygarde

Given the track record for Pokémon games, it comes as no surprise to find this supersized Pokémon Legends Z-A leak online, and you can likely expect more information to surface in the next three days before the game comes out.

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if there’s anything we’ve missed and what you’re most looking forward to in Pokémon Legends Z-A.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that images of Everwild have appeared online

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-legends-z-a-pokedex-leaked-in-full/

item.title: Rare’s Cancelled Everwild Screenshots Emerge, Report Claims
item.content:encoded:
Screenshots from Rare’s cancelled multiplayer title Everwild have surfaced, according to one report.

Revealed in 2019, Everwild was set to be the next big thing from Rare under Xbox. With multiplayer and a forest-themed premise, the game had been silent for quite some time. It was still in the works whenever asked and development had seemed to be progressing. Unfortunately, due to Microsoft layoffs, multiple titles were cancelled, including Perfect Dark, Project Blackbird, and Everwild. However, a credible report shows some screenshots of the game’s gameplay and UI that never made it to the public.

Everwild Reportedly Leaked Screenshots Include Gameplay, UI Elements

In a report from Mp1st, which leaked Perfect Dark concept art, the site obtained in-progress screenshots of Rare’s Everwild. In the pictures, available here, there are plenty of things to go off of. We get a look at some of the menu designs and characters, which seem on par with the reveal trailer. We also see some scenery and the playable protagonist alongside a gardening-esque system. Of course, these pictures are not yet verified, so take the news with a grain of salt.

Everwild, last time it was reported, was in a playable state. While we don’t know how far along it was, it seems it was shaping up quite nicely. Unfortunately, we may never be able to play it, though it is cool to see what it could’ve been. Rare has only shipped a handful of games under Microsoft and, given it’s only new notable IP is Sea of Thieves, Everwild would’ve been a nice breather. It’s unknown what is next for Rare and Microsoft, despite rumors of Banjo-Kazooie returning.

What do you think of the screenshots for Everwild? Do you hope it sees the light of day again? Are you sad that Xbox cancelled it? Let us know in the comments, forums, and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Xbox news, check out our articles on Perfect Dark’s almost revival and the removal of DLC discounts. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender Is Getting A New Fighting Game
item.content:encoded:
Avatar: The Last Airbender is finally getting a fighting game from Gameplay Group and Paramount.

The Avatar: The Last Airbender series, which ran from 2005-2008 on Nickelodeon, remains a beacon of animation to this day. The elemental-combat and charming characters worked then and made a huge resurgence during COVID-19. With a new movie and series in the works, the franchise is still going strong. While games haven’t been a strong suit, a new title has been revealed, and it’s a genre fans have been waiting for.

In the trailer, shown above, we get our first look at an Avatar-set fighting game, simply called Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game. Along with the announcement, we see some interesting hand-drawn 2D gameplay with fan-favorite characters like Aang, Zuko, Sokka, Azula, and Toph. It also looks like Korra from the sequel series The Legend of Korra, will be present, but no characters from the show were revealed as fighters. It will launch with 12 playable characters, with more released on a seasonal basis.

Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game will feature movement-centric gameplay and an original story. Alongside the additions are net code and crossplay, now must-haves for new fighting titles. The game is being developed by Paramount and Gameplay Group, who helped develop Them Fighting Herds. As of now, the title, Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game, is not official and may change. New features are also set to be announced later, though no hints were given. It will release on Nintendo Switch 2, PC via Steam, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S in Summer 2026.

An official Steam page was also released for players to wishlist the title. The Avatar series is way past due for a fighting game, so Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game is sure to hit the spot. While it’s not coming until Summer 2026, it looks like it will be well worth the wait.

Are you excited for Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game? Did you watch Avatar: The Last Airbender? Who’s your favorite Avatar? Let us know in the comments, forums, and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more on Avatar, check out our articles on the upcoming RPG and its collaboration with Sonic Racing CrossWorlds. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
